entities.name: lupin
entities.description: Lupin is described as being younger and less shabby than before, with thicker and darker hair. He looks happy to be back in a familiar place.

entities.name: lily
entities.description: Lily's smile is described as the widest of all, and her green eyes are compared to Lupin's. She searches his face hungrily.

entities.name: james
entities.description: James is mentioned as saying that Harry is nearly there and very close, and that they are proud of him.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry asks if dying hurts, and Lupin responds by saying it's quicker and easier than falling asleep. Harry also says he didn't want any of them to die.

entities.name: sirius
entities.description: Sirius is mentioned as responding to Harry's question about dying, saying it doesn't hurt at all and is quicker than falling asleep.

entities.name: place
entities.description: The place where Lupin is standing is described as a familiar scene of many adolescent wanderings.

relationships.description: Lupin looks at Lily, and his eyes feast on her. He thinks he would like to stand and look at her forever.
James praises Harry, saying he is nearly there and very close, and that they are proud of him.
Sirius responds to Harry's question about dying by saying it doesn't hurt at all.
Lupin comforts Harry by telling him that dying is quicker and easier than falling asleep.
